intro: Erysimum andrzejowscianum, commonly known as the Andrzejowski's wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, often along walls or in open fields. Its narrow, linear leaves and showy flowers make it a distinctive and ornamental species.
